title: Man With No Arms Can Shoot Bow

content.en: Can you shoot a bow? It's easy. Put the arrow on the string of the bow. Pull the string. Where do you want the arrow to go? That's your target. Point at your target. Let go of the string. Watch the arrow fly!
content.tw: 你會射箭嗎? 很簡單，把箭放在弓弦上，然後拉弓。你希望弓箭往哪裡射呢? 瞄準你的目標，然後放箭。

content.en: Shooting a bow for sport is fun! But do we need arms to do it?
content.tw: 射箭運動很好玩! 但我們需要手臂才能射箭嗎?

content.en: Ask Matt Stutzman. He was born with no arms. He shoots a bow.
content.tw: 問問看Matt Stutzman，他天生沒有手臂，但他會射箭。

content.en: How does Matt do this? He holds his bow with his foot. He pulls the string with his chin.
content.tw: 他怎麼做到的呢? 他用腳拿弓，用下巴拉弓。

content.en: Matt can hit any target. He shoots very well. He won a silver medal for the USA at the Paralympics. This big competition is for athletes with disabilities.
content.tw: Matt很會射箭，他代表美國在帕運會拿下銀牌。帕運會是為身障運動員舉辦的比賽。

content.en: Matt wants everyone to know he can do anything. His disability doesn't stop him. Matt wants to win a gold medal at next year's Paralympics.
content.tw: Matt希望每一個人都知道身體的缺陷無法限制他，他可以做任何事。他希望能在明年帕運會上贏得金牌。

content.en: This Sunday is the International Day of Persons with Disabilities. Let's learn about Matt and other people with disabilities. Let's learn what they can do!
content.tw: 這個禮拜天是國際身心障礙者日。我們可以從Matt跟其他的身心障礙者身上學習他們可以做到的事。

content.en: Matt uses what he has... and he hits his target!
content.tw: Matt運用他所擁有的…並且達成了他的目標！

vocabulary.preface: 用腳也可以射箭，真是了不起的本領!

content.text: 1. shoot 射擊 Check this out, Nancy. 你看，南西。 I'm going to shoot the bullseye this time. 我這次要射中紅心。 Sure, just like last time when you hit the teacher's hat. 當然，就跟你上次射中老師的帽子一樣。
2. point 指著 I wasn't pointing at her hat! 我並沒有瞄準她的帽子! Oh no, I can't believe I missed it! 我不敢相信我沒射中!
3. target 箭靶 You still hit the target. 你還是射中箭靶啦。 But not the center. 但是不是中心。
4. let go of 放手 I think I let go of the arrow too late. 我覺得我放箭的時間太晚了。 No worries. You'll get better. 別擔心，你會進步的。 Now let me give it a try.現在讓我來試試。

title: The Beatles Make One More Song

content.en: Who are the Beatles? They're a band from the UK. Many people think the Beatles are the best band in the world!
content.tw: 你知道披頭四嗎? 那是一個英國樂團。很多人覺得披頭四是世界上最棒的樂團。

content.en: The Beatles had four people: John, Paul, George, and Ringo. But they stopped being a band in nineteen seventy. Sadly, John died ten years later…
content.tw: 披頭四有四位成員，約翰、保羅、喬治跟林哥，他們在1970就解散了。十年後約翰不幸地去世。

content.en: But now the Beatles have a new song. What? How can they have a new song? Well, John wrote a song many years ago. It's called "Now and Then". He recorded it on a cassette tape.
content.tw: 但現在披頭四要發行一首新歌 「這時候那時候」。他們怎麼會有新歌呢? 原來約翰很多年前寫了這首歌，並且錄在卡帶上。

content.en: But the recording was very bad. John's voice was hard to hear.
content.tw: 但是錄音品質很糟糕，聽不清楚約翰的聲音。

content.en: After John died, Paul, George, and Ringo took this old song and made it better. But it needed more work. Then George died…
content.tw: 約翰死後，保羅、喬治跟林哥拿到這首老歌，提升了它的品質，但還需要修改。喬治後來也過世了。

content.en: This year, the Beatles made John's voice easy to hear. How did they do that? They used AI.
content.tw: 今年他們用AI人工智慧，讓約翰的聲音更清楚地呈現。

content.en: All four Beatles worked on this song. Paul and Ringo finished it. "Now and Then" is on the radio a lot now. Many people like the song. Many think "Now and Then" is a sad song. But they also think it's a beautiful song.
content.tw: 披頭四的四位成員都參與了這首歌的製作。保羅和林哥完成了它。「這時候那時候」現在廣泛在電台播放。很多人喜歡這首歌。許多人認為「這時候那時候」是一首悲傷的歌。但他們也認為這是一首美麗的歌。

vocabulary.preface: 所有披頭四的成員先後都參與了這首歌的製作，人工智慧也幫了忙。

title: Man Will Ride Bike Across the South Pole

content.en: Man Will Ride Bike Across the South Pole What is the loneliest place in the world? It's somewhere very few people live. Maybe it’s Antarctica! That’s the cold, snowy place around the South Pole.
content.tw: 這世界上最寂寞的地方在哪裡呢? 應該是南極洲，那裡很冷、而且滿地都是雪。

content.en: Omar Di Felice wants to ride his bike all the way across Antarctica. He tried to do this last year. But he stopped after one week. He felt too lonely. His family needed him too.
content.tw: Omar Di Felice 想騎著單車跨越南極洲。他去年試過一次，但一個星期後就放棄了。他當時覺得太孤單寂寞，他的家人也需要他。

content.en: Now Omar wants to try again. He will start at one side. He will cross the South Pole. Then he will finish at the other side. He will ride two thousand kilometers!
content.tw: Omar 現在想再試一次。他要從南極洲的一端騎車2000公里到另一邊。

content.en: Omar has a special bike. It's called a fatbike. It has wide tires. Omar can ride on snow and ice with this bike. He can carry his tent, clothes, and food on this bike.
content.tw: Omar有一個特別的單車，叫做粗輪自行車。這種腳踏車有很寬的輪胎，可以騎在冰雪地面，也可以搭載帳篷、衣服跟食物。

content.en: Riding a bike across Antarctica will not be easy. It will be very cold and very windy. The bike will be heavy. But Omar wants to do this.
content.tw: 騎單車橫越南極洲可不容易，又冷又颳著風。單車也很笨重，但是Omar還是要這麼做。

content.en: Omar will be the first to ride a bike all the way across Antarctica. He knows he will be lonely. But this time, he’s ready!
content.tw: Omar 將會是第一個騎單車橫越南極洲的人。他知道自己會很孤單，但這次他準備好了！

vocabulary.preface: 在南極洲騎單車雖然困難重重，Omar仍然決定再接再厲。

title: 12-Year-Old Engineer Finds Fires Faster

content.en: Engineering is about inventing things. Thanks to engineers, we have all kinds of inventions: trains, computers, ovens, radios, light bulbs...!
content.tw: 工程這種專業跟發明有關。多虧有工程師，我們才有火車、電腦、烤箱、廣播、燈泡!

content.en: There's a contest in the USA. It's for middle school students who love science, technology, engineering, and math.
content.tw: 美國有一個競賽，讓喜歡科學、科技、工程和數學的學生參加。

content.en: This year's winner is Shanya Gill. She's a 12-year-old engineer! Shanya won 25,000 US dollars. That's about 800,000 Taiwan dollars!
content.tw: 今年的冠軍是Shanya Gill，她是一位年僅12歲的工程師! Shanya贏得2萬5美金，相當於80萬台幣。

content.en: A restaurant by Shanya's house had a big fire. Nobody was hurt. But it gave Shanya a great idea…
content.tw: Shanya家附近的餐廳之前發生火災。沒有人受傷，但是這給了Shanya一個靈感。

content.en: Most fire alarms find smoke in the air. Then these smoke alarms make a very loud sound. People know there's danger after a fire starts.
content.tw: 大多的煙霧警報器偵測到煙才會發出聲音。人們要等到火燒起來後才知道有危險。

content.en: Shanya's fire alarm has a special camera. The camera sees heat. People know there's danger before a fire starts.
content.tw: Shanya的警報器則是找出熱源。它有個特別的攝影機。攝影機拍到熱源就會在火燒起來之前警告大家。

content.en: Shanya says her fire alarm is faster, cheaper, and better than smoke alarms. And she's making it better!
content.tw: Shanya說她的火災警報器更快、更便宜、也比煙霧警報好，而且她還在繼續改善它。

content.en: Shanya's invention can save lives, houses, and more. Bravo, Engineer Shanya!
content.tw: Shanya的發明可以拯救生命、房屋等等。Shanya工程師，太棒了！

vocabulary.preface: 12歲的女孩，發明了可以拯救性命的預防火災裝置。

title: Sleeping Seal Stops Woman from Working

content.en: What's that sound? Oh, there's a seal in the water! What a cute animal!
content.tw: 原來是有一隻海豹在水裡，牠好可愛!

content.en: Seals swim in the ocean to find fish to eat. They don't have arms or feet. They have flippers. They use their front flippers to come onto land to rest.
content.tw: 海豹在海裡游泳尋找魚類。牠們沒有手跟腳，但是有鰭。牠們用前鰭爬上岸休息。

content.en: Amber lives near a beach in Australia. One morning, a loud noise woke her up. Was someone taking her car?
content.tw: Amber住在澳洲海邊附近，有一天早上，很大的噪音把她吵醒，是有人要偷走她的車子嗎?

content.en: Amber went to a window. She looked outside. A big seal was sleeping next to her car!
content.tw: Amber到窗邊往外看，一頭很大的海豹睡在她的車子旁邊。

content.en: Amber knew about this seal. The people in her town call him Neil. They see Neil on beaches. But this was the first time Neil visited someone's house!
content.tw: Amber認得這頭海豹，這附近的人都叫這隻海豹Neil。他們在海灘上看過牠，但是這是第一次看到Neil造訪別人家。

content.en: Amber had to go to work. But Neil was too close to her car. There was no way to move him. Neil weighs six hundred kilograms! So Amber waited for Neil to wake up and move. She called her boss.
content.tw: Amber得去上班，但是Neil太靠近她的車子。牠重達600公斤，根本沒有辦法移動牠。Amber要等到Neil睡醒之後才能離開，她只好打電話給老闆。

content.en: Amber's boss laughed about the sleeping seal. Amber sent pictures to show her story was real. A sleeping seal named Neil stopped Amber from going to work. What a cute story!
content.tw: Amber的老闆嘲笑了這隻睡著的海豹。Amber傳了照片證明她的故事是真的。一隻名叫Neil的睡著的海豹阻止了Amber去上班。這真是個可愛的故事！

vocabulary.preface: 一頭海豹擋住了車子，讓Amber沒辦法開車上班。

title: This Planet Has Clouds Made of Sand

content.en: Scientists study planets, stars, and more in space. Space is cool. It has many surprises!
content.tw: 科學家研究太空中的行星跟恆星，還有其他很多現象。外太空總是帶給我們各種驚喜。

content.en: WASP-107b is a planet. It's much bigger than Earth. It's much hotter. It's about 500 degrees! It's close to its sun, so one year is six days!
content.tw: 行星WASP-107b比地球大很多，也比地球熱。它距離它的太陽很近，所以它一年只有6天。

content.en: WASP-107b is strange. Winds blow 36,000 kilometers per hour. And the planet is very light and fluffy! Some scientists call it a "cotton candy" planet.
content.tw: 這顆行星很奇怪。它又輕又蓬鬆，風速還高達6000公里，科學家把它叫做「棉花糖行星」。

content.en: WASP-107b's clouds are very strange. They're made of... sand?!? Scientists think the rocks in the sand are very small. They're smaller than the rocks in Earth's sand.
content.tw: 它的雲層也很奇怪，是由細沙組成。科學家認為沙子中的顆粒非常小，比地球的沙粒小很多。

content.en: These sand clouds make sand rain! The sand goes down to the planet. It turns into a gas. The gas goes up to the clouds. Water does the same on Earth.
content.tw: 這些沙雲會下沙雨! 落到行星的表面就會變成氣體，這些氣體又會上升變成雲，就像地球的水一樣。

content.en: How do scientists know about these sand clouds? A special space telescope showed them. It's helping scientists find out more about space.
content.tw: 科學家透過韋伯太空望遠鏡觀察到這些沙雲。這種望遠鏡幫助科學家更了解太空。

content.en: Clouds rain sand onto a cotton candy planet. What a surprise!
content.tw: 沙雲下在棉花糖行星上。真是令人驚訝！

vocabulary.preface: 這個太陽系外的行星，非常特別。

title: Museum to Give Back Important Headdress

content.en: Indigenous people are the first to live in a place. Taiwan has many Indigenous groups: Amis people, Paiwan people, Atayal people, and others.
content.tw: 原住民指的是最開始定居在一個地方的族群。台灣有很多原住民族，像是阿美族、排灣族、泰雅族等等。

content.en: Indigenous groups live all over the world. They have sacred traditions and beliefs. These are very, very important things the groups do and think.
content.tw: 世界各地都有原住民。他們有神聖的傳統跟信仰，這對他們做事情或是思考的方式非常重要。

content.en: They have sacred things. Some are headdresses. These are beautiful head coverings. They have important meanings.
content.tw: 他們有神聖的東西，例如頭飾，也就是戴在頭上的美麗裝飾，這些都有重要的意義。

content.en: The Siksika Nation is an Indigenous group in Canada. About one hundred thirty years ago, a man from the UK took a sacred headdress from them. Then he took it back to the UK. It was in a museum there for more than one hundred years.
content.tw: 西格西卡人是加拿大原住民。130年前，一名英國男子拿走族人的頭飾，帶回英國，收藏在博物館裡超過100年。

content.en: The Siksika headdress has eagle and hawk feathers. It has buffalo horns and porcupine quills. Long ago, an important woman wore it to important religious events.
content.tw: 這個頭飾有老鷹羽毛、水牛角跟豪豬的刺。很久以前，只有身分重要的女性才能穿戴去宗教場合。

content.en: Now the Siksika Nation wants it back!
content.tw: 現在西格西卡人想把它拿回來。

content.en: The museum is sorry they had the headdress. They know it's very important. They're giving it back to the Siksika Nation next year.
content.tw: 博物館覺得很抱歉擁有這個頭飾，他們明白它的重要性，也會在明年歸還給西格西卡人。

content.en: Museums everywhere have sacred things. Let's hope these sacred things go home to their people!
content.tw: 世界各地的博物館都收藏著神聖的物品。希望這些神聖的物品都能回到他們族人的手中！

vocabulary.preface: 英國的博物館對這個原住民族群很抱歉，準備歸還多年前取得的頭飾。

content.text: 1. tradition 傳統 Do Taiwanese women wear a white gown…台灣女子穿不穿白色禮服... when they get married? 結婚時嗎? Yeah, they do. It's a tradition.穿啊，那是傳統。

title: Pets Put On Kimonos for a Special Day in Japan

content.en: Japan has special days for kids. There's Girls' Day. There's Children's Day. There's Shichi-Go-San. Kids think New Year's Day is their day too!
content.tw: 日本有很多兒童的特殊節日，像是女兒節、兒童節、七五三節，甚至是新年兒童也覺得是他們的節日。

content.en: On some special days, families go to a shrine. They pray for their kids' health and happiness.
content.tw: 在特殊節日，父母會帶孩子去神社，祈求孩子健康幸福。

content.en: But Japan doesn't have many kids. Every year, fewer and fewer kids go to shrines.
content.tw: 但是日本少子化，去神社參拜的兒童越來越少。

content.en: Many people have dogs and cats. More and more people take their pets to a shrine. They pray for their pet's health and happiness. But Japan has no special days for pets.
content.tw: 很多人養寵物貓或是狗，帶寵物去神社的人日漸增多，祈求牠們健康平安。但是日本沒有寵物的特殊節日。

content.en: Now there's a special day at the Dog-Cat Shrine near Tokyo! It's Shichi-Go-San for pets. This shrine makes human mommies and daddies of dogs and cats happy.
content.tw: 鄰近東京的神社現在舉辦寵物的七五三節，讓毛小孩主人很開心。

content.en: Kids wear special clothes called kimonos for Shichi-Go-San. So pets wear kimonos too!
content.tw: 兒童會在七五三節穿上和服，貓狗也會在這天穿上和服。

content.en: Kids have to be three, five, or seven years old for Shichi-Go-San. So pets have to be three, five, or seven years old too.
content.tw: 兒童到了三歲、五歲或七歲就會在七五三節去神社參拜。寵物也是一樣。

content.en: For many people, their pets are their family. Now their pets share in a special kids' day at the Dog-Cat Shrine!
content.tw: 對於許多人來說，他們的寵物就是家人。現在他們的寵物也能在狗狗貓貓神社分享一個特別的兒童節！

vocabulary.preface: 寵物很像家人，也有屬於牠們的節日。

1. fewer and fewer 越來越少
There are fewer and fewer people keeping birds as pets.

Oh, yes, their sounds were sweet. 會啊，牠們的歌聲很好聽。
They made my family very happy. 讓我的家人很開心。

title: From Street Cleaner to Ballet Dancer

content.en: Dancing is an art. It's creative. It's beautiful. And it's very, very difficult!
content.tw: 跳舞是一種藝術。它很優美但是也很難。

content.en: Liu Ziqing is from a small village in northern China. As a boy, he watched a movie about ballet. He loved it. So he watched it again and again and again… He watched the same movie more than ten times!
content.tw: 劉子青來自中國北方的小村落。他小時候看了一部關於芭蕾的電影，他非常喜歡，看了很多次。

content.en: Ziqing had a dream. He wanted to be a ballet dancer. But his family was very poor. They had no money for ballet lessons. So Ziqing forgot about his dream.
content.tw: 他夢想成為芭蕾舞者，但是他家太窮了，沒有錢負擔芭蕾舞課。

content.en: Ziqing grew up. He fell in love and got married. He had a family. He became a farmer. He also worked as a street cleaner.
content.tw: 劉子青長大成家，而他的工作是農夫跟清道夫。

content.en: Years went by. Then Ziqing was 53 years old. He saw a TV program. It was for ballet lessons!
content.tw: 很多年之後，53歲的劉子青看到電視上有芭蕾舞課程。

content.en: That was ten years ago. Ziqing is 63 years old now. And he's living his dream!
content.tw: 十年過去了。劉子青現在63歲，他實現了他的夢想!

content.en: Ziqing is now a professional ballet dancer! He's very popular. His story has gone viral online!
content.tw: 他現在是專業的芭蕾舞者，非常受大家歡迎。 他的故事也在網路上流傳。

content.en: It took Ziqing many, many years to follow his dream. Now he's very happy! Do you have a dream?
content.tw: 劉子青花了很多很多年才追隨他的夢想。現在他非常快樂！你有夢想嗎？

vocabulary.preface: 63歲的芭蕾爺爺，非常高興終於能夠實現夢想。

content.text: 1. dream 夢想 My dream is to write a book. 我夢想寫一本書。 I didn't know you're a writer.我不知道你是作家。
2. difficult 困難的 I'm not, and that's why I need time to practice. 我不是，這是為什麼我需要時間練習。 Writing is a difficult art. 寫作是一門困難的藝術。
3. creative 創造性的 It's a creative art. 它是創作的藝術。 I need to think of something that nobody has written before. 我得想一些沒有人寫過的東西。
4. online 在網路上 What about runaway lions? 逃走的獅子怎麼樣? But I know nothing about lions! 但是我對獅子一無所知! That's okay. I'm sure it'll go viral online. 沒關係。我敢說一定會在網路上爆紅。

title: Animal Video Surprises Scientists

content.en: Sir David's echidnas lived when dinosaurs lived. That was two hundred million years ago! These animals were living sixty years ago. After that, scientists didn't see any alive. They thought these echidnas were extinct…
content.tw: 艾登堡針鼴鼠從2億年前恐龍還沒滅絕的時候就存在。牠們消失了60年。科學家以為牠們絕種了。

content.en: But last month, scientists found a Sir David's echidna! It was on a mountain in Indonesia. They weren't looking for it. They put video cameras outside. The cameras took videos of animals. The scientists looked at the videos later. Then they saw the echidna! They were very surprised!
content.tw: 但是在上個月，科學家在印尼山上拍到艾登堡針鼴鼠。他們非常驚訝!

content.en: Sir David's echidnas are cool. Their nose is twenty centimeters long! These echidnas blow bubbles from their nose to cool down.
content.tw: 艾登堡針鼴鼠很特別。牠們的鼻子長達20公分，還會從鼻子噴泡泡來降溫。

content.en: They make holes in soft dirt with their nose. They make holes to find food.
content.tw: 牠們還會在土裡挖洞覓食。

content.en: Sir David's echidnas don't have teeth. Their long, sticky tongue gets food fast! They eat ants and earthworms.
content.tw: 牠們沒有牙齒，但是有又長又黏的舌頭吃螞蟻跟蚯蚓。

content.en: These echidnas have quills. Quills are sharp and spiky. When an echidna is scared, it rolls into a spiky ball! No animals want to touch a spiky ball!
content.tw: 這些針鼴鼠身上也有尖銳的刺。如果牠們受到驚嚇，身體會縮成一顆球，防止其他的動物靠近。

content.en: These cool Sir David's echidnas aren't extinct. They're living! That's great for them - and us!
content.tw: 這些酷酷的艾登堡針鼴鼠沒有滅絕。牠們還活著！這對牠們來說太棒了——對我們也是！

vocabulary.preface: 這種奇特的動物原本以為已經絕種，不料卻重新露面。

look at 注視
Hey, look at what I found! 你看我找到的東西!
Wow, so cool! 哇，真酷!
But are they bones? 但這些是骨頭嗎?
Maybe, I'm not sure. 也許吧，我不確定。

teeth 牙齒
They look like teeth, right? 它們看起來像牙齒，對不對?
They could be, but you should show them to scientists.
有可能，不過你應該拿給科學家看。

ago 以前
Yeah, scientists should be able to answer my questions.
對，科學家應該可以回答我的問題。
They can tell you how long ago these animals
lived.他們會告訴你這些動物生活在多久以前。

look for 尋找
Let's look for more bones here. 我們在這裡多找找骨頭。
Right, we may find a big dinosaur! 對啊，我們可能找到一隻大恐龍!

title: New York City's Flying Taxis

content.en: Nobody likes sitting in traffic! Cars, buses, and trucks move very slowly. They make lots of bad smells, dirty air, and noise! People get angry. They honk their horns.
content.tw: 沒有人喜歡塞車。塞車的時候，車輛很緩慢地移動。這樣會製造很多噪音、廢氣。駕駛也容易生氣，一直按喇叭。

content.en: How can we get away from all that slow, stinky, noisy traffic?
content.tw: 我們如何避免慢吞吞，臭烘烘，而且吵鬧的塞車呢?

content.en: There's great news! New taxis are coming to New York City. They're electric, so they don't make bad smells or dirty air. And they never sit in traffic… Why? Because these taxis can fly!
content.tw: 好消息! 紐約有新的電動計程車，沒有廢氣，還不會塞車。為什麼呢?因為這些計程車會飛ㄟ!

content.en: Electric air taxis look like very big drones with car seats! They fly with six small propellers. These make flying easier.
content.tw: 空中計程車看起來像大型的無人機，裡面有汽車座椅，還有六個螺旋槳。

content.en: Electric air taxis can fly in all directions. They can go up and down, left and right, to the front and to the back!
content.tw: 空中計程車可以飛上下、左右、往前、還往後。

content.en: Electric air taxis can carry a pilot and four passengers. These air taxis are fast. They take seven minutes to fly from the airport to the middle of the city. That's much, much faster than driving!
content.tw: 空中計程車可以搭載一名駕駛跟四位乘客。從機場到市中心只需要7分鐘，比汽車快得多。

content.en: Do you want to fly an electric air taxi in New York City one day? It will be love at first flight!
content.tw: 你有一天想在紐約市搭乘電動空中計程車嗎？這將會是一見鍾情！

vocabulary.preface: 空中計程車可能成為未來最受歡迎的交通工具。

content.text:
1. fly 飛
I can't wait for these taxis to come here! 我簡直等不及這些計程車來這裡了。
Yeah, imagine seeing them flying outside the office window.
對啊，想像一下它們就在辦公室外面飛。

2. electric 電力的
They look just like helicopters. 它們很像直升機。
But they're electric, so very quiet. 不過是用電力，所以很安靜。

3. up and down 上上下下
There will be traffic jams in the air! 會發生空中塞車!
No, because they can go up and down, left and right.
不會，因為它們可以上上下下，左左右右。

4. easier 比較容易的
You really like to take a flying taxi, don't you?
你真的會很想搭空中計程車，對吧?
I do. It will make my life so much easier! 對啊，會讓我的生活輕鬆得多。

title: Horse Makes Plane Go Back to Airport

content.en: Do you dream about traveling with your pet? In Taiwan, you can travel by plane with your dog, cat, or rabbit. But in the plane, animals don't sit with people.
content.tw: 你有想過跟寵物一起旅行嗎?在台灣，你可以跟寵物貓、狗或兔子一起坐飛機旅行，但是寵物不會跟人坐在一起。

content.en: Animals are in the cargo hold. That's where the suitcases are. Dogs, cats, and other animals are safe in cages there. But sometimes, an animal gets out!
content.tw: 寵物會關在籠子裡，待在堆放行李的貨艙。但有時候，寵物會跑出來。

content.en: A plane was taking horses from New York to Europe. A strong wind blew. The plane shook!
content.tw: 一架載著馬的飛機要從紐約飛往歐洲。突然颳大風，讓飛機發生震動。

content.en: A horse got out of its cage! No one knows how it got out. But the horse did not go back into its cage!
content.tw: 結果有一匹馬跑出了籠子，沒有人知道牠是怎麼出來的，但是也沒有辦法讓牠回到籠子裡。

content.en: The pilot needed help! He turned the plane around. He wanted to go back to New York for help. But the plane was too heavy! It was dangerous to land!
content.tw: 飛機的駕駛想要掉頭回紐約尋求幫助，但是飛機的燃油還滿載，太重了，降落的時候會有危險。

content.en: So the pilot let fifty six thousand liters of gas go into the air outside. Then the plane landed safely. An animal doctor helped the horse.
content.tw: 所以飛機駕駛在空中放掉5萬6千公升的油，讓飛機安全的降落。獸醫也來檢查馬的狀況。

content.en: This horse got out of his cage. But most animals are safe in planes. When you take your pet on a plane, make sure your pet can stay in its cage!
content.tw: 這匹馬跑出了籠子。但大多數動物在飛機上是安全的。當你帶寵物搭飛機時，請確保你的寵物能待在牠的籠子裡！

vocabulary.preface: 這匹逃出來的馬讓飛機駕駛緊張，只好回頭降落紐約機場。

content.text:
1. plane 飛機
Why are you packing your cat's stuff? 妳為什麼在打包貓的東西?
Because I'm taking him on board a plane.因為我要帶牠搭飛機。

2. travel 旅行
What?! Are you kidding? 什麼啊，你在開玩笑吧?
They won't let you travel with Charlie.他們不會讓你跟查理一起旅行的。
I know that. He'll be in cargo. 我知道，牠會待在貨艙。

3. shake 震動
He'll be scared when the plane shakes.飛機震動時牠會害怕。
It shouldn't be that bad.不會那麼糟糕。
Charlie is a strong cat. 查理是很堅強的貓。

4. sometimes 有時候
Sometimes I really don't understand you. 有時候我真搞不懂你。
Well, I just don't want to leave Charlie. 我就是不想離開 Charlie.

title: Mysteries of 100,000 Old Coins Found in Japan

content.en: Scientists found 100,000 very old coins in Japan! Now they have many mysteries to solve!
content.tw: 科學家在日本找到10萬個古老硬幣! 現在他們有很多謎團要解開!

content.en: The owner of the coins is a mystery. But the person who put the coins in the ground is a mystery too. Maybe the owner buried the coins. Or... maybe thieves buried them!
content.tw: 這些硬幣的主人是誰，又是誰把它們埋進了土裡? 可能是硬幣的主人，也可能是小偷。

content.en: The reason the coins were buried is a mystery. Maybe the owner was worried about a war or was hiding them from a king. Maybe the coins were too heavy for thieves!
content.tw: 為甚麼要埋這些錢呢? 硬幣主人可能擔心戰爭，或是被國王搶走。還是小偷覺得太重了!

content.en: The coins are a mystery. The oldest are 2,000 years old! Why did the owner have these very old coins? Maybe the owner liked old coins. Maybe in the owner's family, the coins went from parent to child many, many, many times!
content.tw: 這些硬幣有的可以追溯到2000年前，也許這個人就喜歡收集古錢，也有可能傳了好幾代。

content.en: Many of the coins are Chinese. Maybe Chinese traders came here many times. Maybe Japanese traders went to China.
content.tw: 很多硬幣來自中國。也許中國貿易商來過日本很多次，或是日本商人去過中國。

content.en: Can scientists solve all the mysteries about these 100,000 old coins? What do you think?
content.tw: 科學家能解開這10萬個古老硬幣的所有謎團嗎？你覺得呢？

vocabulary.preface: 在日本出土的古老錢幣，讓專家非常好奇。

content.text:
1. thief 竊賊
Why would a thief want to steal coins? 小偷為什麼想偷硬幣?
They are heavy and worthless! 它又重又不值錢。
Maybe he can't find gold.也許他找不黃金?

2. maybe 也許
Or maybe he likes the sound of coins. 也或許他喜歡錢幣的聲音。
That's a good reason.那是很好的理由。
I like the sound too. 我也喜歡那個聲音。

3. old 古老的
There's something about old coins. 古老錢幣很特別。
You feel you're touching history.你覺得好像在觸摸歷史。
Really? 真的嗎?

4. king 君王
Yeah, think about it. 對啊，你想想看.
Kings, traders and common people would all use them.

title: Chick Makes Zoo Happy

content.en: There are many kinds of penguins. Some of them live in a very cold place called Antarctica. The Emperor penguin lives there.
content.tw: 世界上有很多種不同的企鵝。南極洲就有皇帝企鵝。

content.en: Mother Emperor penguins lay an egg once a year. They give the egg to the father. The father emperor penguin sits on it. He keeps it warm 24 hours a day... for 65 days! This helps the penguin chick grow inside the egg.
content.tw: 每一年皇帝企鵝媽媽只下一顆蛋。然後交給企鵝爸爸孵蛋65天，讓企鵝寶寶長大。

content.en: Some Emperor penguins live in a zoo. One day, workers found an egg. A baby Emperor penguin was coming! This egg was special!
content.tw: 動物園裡也有皇帝企鵝。有一天，工作人員找到一顆皇帝企鵝蛋，有一隻企鵝寶寶要誕生了。

content.en: The workers kept the egg warm. The chick grew safely inside the egg. Then it was ready to come out!
content.tw: 工作人員讓蛋保持溫暖，企鵝寶寶才能在蛋裡平安長大，準備孵化。

content.en: But the egg was too hard for the chick! The workers made a small hole in the egg. For two days, they helped the chick come out!
content.tw: 但是蛋殼對企鵝寶寶來說太硬了!工作人員在蛋上鑽了一個小洞。花了兩天的時間幫助企鵝寶寶鑽出來。

content.en: The workers were very happy. Almost no Emperor penguins are born in zoos. This zoo waited 13 years for this Emperor penguin chick!
content.tw: 工作人員很高興，動物園整整等了13年才第一次迎接皇帝企鵝寶寶的誕生!

content.en: The zoo asked everyone to pick the new baby chick's name. They picked the name "Pearl." Pearl's a special chick!
content.tw: 動物園請大家為這隻新的企鵝寶寶取名字。他們選了「珍珠」這個名字。珍珠是一隻特別的企鵝寶寶！

vocabulary.preface: 這座動物園歡喜迎接一隻皇帝企鵝寶寶。

content.text:
1. name 名字
What's a good name for an anteater? 食蟻獸叫什麼名字好?
Anteaters? 食蟻獸?
The new baby anteater born in the zoo? 那隻生在動物園的食蟻獸寶寶?
Right, that's the one.對，就是那隻。

2. ask 問、請求
How about "Snuffle?" "聞聞看"怎麼樣?
Oh, that's a good one! 很棒的名字!
The zoo asks people to offer names? 動物園要大家提供名字嗎?
Yeah, isn't it fun? 對，不是很好玩嗎?

3. come out 出來
I'd like to see the animal.我想看看那隻動物。
Do you think it will come out? 你覺得牠會出來嗎?
That I don't know.這我就不知了。

4. warm 溫暖的
Tomorrow is a very warm day.明天天氣很溫暖。
It'll be a nice day to visit the zoo. 是去動物園玩的好天氣。

title: Dangerous Dragons Seen in Ocean Near Keelung

content.en: Villager: DRAGON!
content.tw: 村民：龍！

content.en: Narrator: In some stories, dragons are very scary. They're huge lizards with wings! They blow fire from their mouths! They eat people! They tear down buildings!
content.tw: 龍在一些故事裡是很可怕的動物。牠們很像長翅膀的大蜥蜴，會噴火、吃人，還會推倒建築物。

content.en: Dragons aren't so bad. Look at dragonflies. They fly, but they don't blow fire! And they're too small to tear down buildings…
content.tw: 但也不是所有的龍都很可怕。像是dragonfly...蜻蜓...會飛但是不會噴火。

content.en: Blue sea dragons sometimes come to the ocean around Taiwan. They're smaller than dragonflies. The biggest are three centimeters long!
content.tw: 海底有一種生物叫「藍龍」有時候會靠近台灣附近海域，牠們只有3公分長。

content.en: They're bright blue on one side and gray on the other. This hides them from birds and fish. They have long, flat bodies with... dragon wings! These are small parts with many long fingers.
content.tw: 牠們長長的身體一邊是亮藍色，另一邊是灰色，還有觸角，看起來就像龍的翅膀。

content.en: Blue sea dragons are called "the most beautiful killers in the ocean." That's because they're very poisonous! If you see a blue sea dragon, stay far, far away!
content.tw: 藍龍被稱為「大海最美的殺手」。因為牠們有毒，要記得離牠們遠一點。

content.en: Seven blue sea dragons were seen in the ocean near Keelung. It's rare to see so many at one time!
content.tw: 在基隆附近海域看到七隻藍龍，很少能一次看到這麼多隻!

content.en: Seven poisonous blue sea dragons are near Keelung... Why are we here?! RUN!!!
content.tw: 七隻有毒的藍龍在基隆附近...我們為什麼在這裡？！快跑！！！

vocabulary.preface: 住在海裡的藍龍不是童話故事裡的龍，而是真正的有毒生物。

content.text:
1. lizard 蜥蜴
Dragons are lizards, right?
No, well, yes.
I mean, dragons are not real.

2. scary 嚇人的
I want my dragons to fly and fight.
In the story you're writing?
Yeah, my dragons will be very scary.

3. hide 躲藏
If I see your dragon, I'll run and hide.
That will be useless because my dragon can find you.

4. tear down 破壞、拆掉
It will tear down your hiding place and eat you!

今天的單字很好玩喔！

scary嚇人的

title: Merry Christmases Around the World!

content.en: Christmas is coming in a few days! Are you excited?
content.tw: 再過幾天就是耶誕節了!你很期待嗎?

content.en: Some people eat special food for Christmas. In the UK, people eat roasted goose, chicken, or turkey. Some people in Ethiopia eat wat with flatbread. Wat is a thick, spicy chicken soup. It's delicious!
content.tw: 耶誕節有些人會準備特別的料理，像是英國人吃烤雞、烤鵝肉或火雞。伊索比亞人吃沃特配薄餅。沃特是一種濃郁辛辣的雞湯，十分美味。

content.en: Some people put up Christmas decorations at home. In the USA and South Korea, people put up Christmas trees, lights, and garlands. Garlands are long, thick lines of leaves. They're beautiful!
content.tw: 美國跟南韓也有人會在家裡擺放耶誕裝飾。像是耶誕樹、燈、跟耶誕花環。

content.en: Some people do things outside. In Australia, Christmas Eve is for Christmas songs. That night, people hold candles and sing. It's hot there, so some people have Christmas at the beach! It's great!
content.tw: 有一些人是在戶外過聖誕節。澳洲在耶誕之夜會唱耶誕歌曲，這天晚上大家拿著蠟燭唱歌。因為天氣熱，有些人會在海邊慶祝。

content.en: Some people go to festivals. In Mexico, a nine-day festival has a pi?ata every night. The pi?ata is star-shaped. There's something inside! Kids hit the pi?ata with a stick. It opens! Candy falls out! It's fun!
content.tw: 也有人參加慶典。墨西哥有個長達9天的耶誕節慶，在那9個晚上都會敲打皮娜塔。小朋友拿著棍子敲打皮娜塔，裡面就會掉出糖果。

content.en: People around the world enjoy Christmas in many ways. Now Santa's on his way. The holiday fun is starting!
content.tw: 世界各地的人們以多種方式享受聖誕節。現在聖誕老人正在路上。節日的樂趣即將開始！

vocabulary.preface: 耶誕節有無窮的魅力，世界各地的人都喜歡慶祝這個節日。

content.text:
1. in many ways 在很多方面
Santa Claus is a fun person in many ways. 耶誕老公公是個有趣的人。
For one thing, he drives a sleigh. 舉例說吧，他駕駛雪撬。

2. excited 興奮高興的
Yeah, that's true. 對啊，確實是。
And everyone is excited to see him. 而且大家都高興看到他。

3. toy 玩具
He gives away toys and other gifts. 他會送玩具和其他的禮物。
People and parents buy those things, too. 爸爸媽媽或是一般人也會買那些。

4. inside, outside 裡面外面
And he doesn't stay inside.而且他不待在屋子裡。
He's always running around outside.他總是在外面跑來跑去。
That's because it's his job! 因為他的工作就是那樣。

來一起讀單字。
in many ways在很多方面
excited高興的

title: Christmas Markets Make You Merry

content.en: At Christmastime, big street markets open in many countries. They're Christmas markets!
content.tw: 聖誕節的時候，有很多國家都會辦聖誕市集。

content.en: Every Christmas market has a big, beautiful Christmas tree with twinkling lights. Bright lights are everywhere you look! The lights can give you a happy holiday feeling!
content.tw: 每一個聖誕市集都有一顆很大、很漂亮、閃閃發光的聖誕樹。

content.en: You can buy lots of things at Christmas markets! There are delicious Christmas drinks, cookies, and breads.
content.tw: 你可以在市集買很多東西! 像是美味的聖誕餅乾、麵包跟飲料。

content.en: There are colorful puzzles, spinning tops, cute dolls, or other toys! There are Christmas stockings, Christmas tree decorations, and …! Whoa, that's a lot of shopping!
content.tw: 還有拼圖、陀螺、娃娃等玩具。也有聖誕襪、聖誕樹裝飾，有好多東西可以逛!

content.en: Christmas markets have other fun things to do! At some markets, you can go up high in a Ferris wheel. Or you can go around and around in a merry-go-round!
content.tw: 聖誕市集也有好玩的設施，你可以坐摩天輪或是旋轉木馬。

content.en: At one market in Hungary, you can go ice-skating around a twinkling Christmas tree. At another market in Singapore, you can visit a very big gingerbread house! At a market in Taiwan and at many other Christmas markets, you can visit Santa Claus!
content.tw: 匈牙利的市集還可以繞著聖誕樹溜冰。新加坡的則是有一個巨大的薑餅屋。台灣跟很多國家的市集還可以遇到聖誕老人。

content.en: Christmas markets are happy places. You can eat, shop, and have a Merry Christmas!
content.tw: 聖誕市集是快樂的地方。你可以在那裡吃東西、購物，度過一個快樂的聖誕節！

vocabulary.preface: 耶誕市集世界各地都有，花樣很多。

content.text:
1. fun 有趣的、好玩的
Don't you just love Christmas markets? 你很喜歡耶誕市集吧?
Yeah, so many fun things to do. 對啊，可以做好多有趣的事。
And so much food to eat! 好多食物可以吃。

2. bread 麵包
I love apple cinnamon bread.我喜歡蘋果肉桂麵包。
It smells so wonderful! 它好香!

3. colorful 色彩繽紛的
And look at those colorful lights! 妳看那些五顏六色的小燈!
I could stay on the merry-go-round all night.我可以在旋轉木馬上待整晚。

4. decoration 裝飾
Wow, that's a huge Christmas tree! 哇，好大一棵耶誕樹!
The decorations are just beautiful! 上面的裝飾真漂亮!
I wish everyday was Christmas Day.我希望每天都是耶誕節。

你有去過任何一種市集嗎?

title: Club Reads One Book for 28 Years

content.en: (Reading) "… The end. …. Whoa… What a great book!
content.tw: 「...完結了。...哇...多棒的一本書啊！」

content.en: Books are adventures! When you read one, you can visit new places, meet cool people, and do amazing things!
content.tw: 書本就是一場冒險！當你閱讀時，你可以造訪新地方、認識很酷的人，並做一些令人驚奇的事！

content.en: In a book club, everyone reads the same book. Friends talk about the places, people, things, and more in the book.
content.tw: 讀書會是讓每一個人都讀一樣的書，討論書裡的人事物。

content.en: Some book clubs read one book every week. Many read one book every month. One book club read one book... for 28 years!
content.tw: 有一些讀書會一周看一本書，或者是一個月一本。但是有個讀書會花了28年才讀完一本書。

content.en: The book is "Finnegan's Wake." People around the world love it! But it's very difficult.
content.tw: 這本書叫做《芬尼根的守靈夜》。很多人喜歡這本書，但是這本書不好讀。

content.en: The writer used about 80 languages. He wrote many strange sentences. And he made new words! That's why this book is very difficult!
content.tw: 作家用了80種語言，寫了很多奇怪的句子，又創了很多新詞，所以困難重重。

content.en: How difficult is "Finnegan's Wake"? Well, the people in the book club read two pages every month! But that was too fast! So they read one page every month! "Finnegan's Wake" has more than 600 pages...
content.tw: 這本書有多難呢? 這個讀書會每個月只看一頁，這本書超過600頁。

content.en: The people finished "Finnegan's Wake." Then they went back to... page one!
content.tw: 他們終於讀完這本書，但是要回到第一頁再看一次。

content.en: A book club read one book for 28 years. And they're reading it again! They're on a great adventure!
content.tw: 一個讀書會花了28年讀完一本書。他們現在又再讀一遍！他們正經歷一場偉大的冒險！

vocabulary.preface: 一本書讀了28年，這個讀書會的會員很認真。

content.text:
1. amazing 讓人讚嘆的
What are you reading? 你在讀什麼?
Lord of the Rings. 魔戒。
That's an amazing book! 那是一本很棒的書!
I know. It really is.我知道，真的很棒。

2. place 地方
The writer created different languages for different places.
作者給不同地方創造了不同的語言。
Yeah, and the actors in the movie talked in those languages!
沒錯，那部電影的演員也用那些語言講話。

3. year 年
But didn't you read the book last year? 但你不是去年就看過那本書了?
I did. And I'm re-reading it. 對，我現在再看一遍。

4. same 同樣的
Why read the same book? 為什麼要讀同一本書?
Why watch the same movie? 為什麼要看同一部電影?
Because you love it! 因為你就是喜歡它啊!

place地方
year年
same同樣的

title: Town Gets Man's Big Secret

content.en: Are you generous? A generous person gives money or help in a kind way. Maybe you're generous. But are you as generous as Geoffrey Holt was?
content.tw: 你是一個慷慨的人嗎?你能像Geoffrey Holt一樣慷慨嗎?

content.en: Who was Geoffrey Holt? Jeffrey was a nice, quiet man. People liked him. He lived in a small town in America called Hinsdale.
content.tw: 他是誰呢?Geoffrey是個安靜又友善的人，他住在美國一個叫Hinsdale的小鎮。

content.en: Geoffrey knew a lot about cars. But he didn't drive a car. He rode a bicycle around town. That's because Geoffrey didn't like to spend much money.
content.tw: Geoffrey很了解車，但是他沒有開車。Geoffrey不喜歡花很多錢，他都在小鎮裡騎腳踏車。

content.en: When he was 82, he died. But Geoffrey had a big secret. He kept the secret for a long time.
content.tw: 但是Geoffrey有個秘密，大家一直到他在82歲過世的時候才發現。

content.en: Geoffrey was rich! He had about four million dollars. Wow! That's more than 125 million Taiwan dollars!
content.tw: 他其實很有錢，他有大約400萬美金，超過1億2500萬台幣。

content.en: Geoffrey gave all his money to Hinsdale when he died. He wanted to help his town.
content.tw: Geoffrey死後把他所有的錢留給這個小鎮，希望可以有所幫助。

content.en: The people of Hinsdale are very happy about the money. They will use Geoffrey's money to help their town. Their schools and other things in their town will be better.
content.tw: Hinsdale的人非常高興，他們打算讓小鎮裡的學校跟其他的設備變得更好。

content.en: Geoffrey Holt was a very generous guy!
content.tw: Geoffrey Holt 是一個非常慷慨的人！

vocabulary.preface: 這位低調的富翁，把他所有的財富都留給他所住的地方。

content.text:
1. die 死亡
How do you want to be remembered when you die? 你死的时候希望人们记得你什么?
That's a very big question! 好大的问题!

2. kind 仁慈的
No, I'm serious.我是认真的。
Okay, I'd like people to say I love my friends.
好吧，我想要大家说我爱朋友。That I'm nice and kind.人很好很和善。

3. happy 快乐的
What about you? 你呢?
I'd like to be remembered as a happy person.我想要别人记得我是个快乐的人。

4. better 更好的
Are you happy now? 你现在快乐吗?
I try to be.我在努力。
I believe I can do better.我相信可以做得更好。
I'll help you. 我会帮你。
Thank you! You are nice and kind. 谢谢，你真的是又好又和善。

vocabulary.postscript:
你今天學到哪些字?
die死亡
kind仁慈的
happy快樂的
better更好的

options: a. Spent a lot of money

title: A Bag Is Floating in the Sky

content.en: What can you see in the sky? You can see the moon and the stars. But now, with binoculars, you can also see a bag.
content.tw: 抬頭看天空可以看到月亮跟星星，但現在用雙筒望遠鏡你也可以看到一個包包。

content.en: What? A bag in the sky? How did that get there?
content.tw: 什麼？一個包包在天上？它是怎麼跑到那裡的？

content.en: It started with two astronauts in space. They were fixing a space station. They wore space suits and worked with special tools. They kept their tools in a tool bag. Then one of the astronauts lost her tool bag.
content.tw: 起因是有兩個太空人穿著太空衣，拿著工具包，修理太空站。但是其中一人沒有抓緊她的工具包。

content.en: You know, everything floats in space. The big white bag floated away. The astronaut could not catch it! The bag is floating up there now.
content.tw: 在太空中所有的東西都會飄浮，那個白色大工具包就這樣飄走了。

content.en: Another astronaut in space saw the bag. It was floating over Japan. People on Earth can see the bag too. The bag is big and white, so it is very bright.
content.tw: 另一個太空人看到工具包飄過日本，它很大，因為是白色的，所以也很亮，人們從地球上都看得到。

content.en: Scientists say the bag will stay up in the sky for a few months. Then it will start falling to Earth.
content.tw: 科學家說這個包包會飄在太空中幾個月才會掉到地球。

content.en: Can you see something white in the sky? Maybe it's a star. Or maybe it's the lost tool bag!
content.tw: 你有在天空中看到白色的東西嗎？也許是星星。或者也許是那個丟失的工具包！

vocabulary.preface: 一個昂貴的工具包，現在正環繞地球軌道飛行。

content.text:
1. float 飄浮
Have you heard about this bag floating in the sky?
你聽說了那個飄在天上的包包嗎?
Yeah, I'd really love to see it.有，我真想看。

2. star 星星
Me too! Do you think it will fly by very fast? 我也是! 你想它會不會飛得很快?
Like a shooting star? 像流星那樣嗎?
No, I don't think so. 我覺得不會。

3. binoculars 望遠鏡
It should go by slowly like a satellite.它應該像衛星一樣慢慢走。
Then I'll bring my binoculars with me. 那我要帶著望遠鏡。

4. stay 停留
To get a better look at the bag? 好把工具包看得更清楚嗎?
Of course. 當然。
When should we go? 我們應該什麼時候去看?
Don't worry. It will stay up there for months.
別擔心，它會待在天上好幾個月呢。

vocabulary.postscript:
你平常會觀看星象嗎?
float飄浮
star星星
binoculars望遠鏡
stay停留

2. Where is the bag now?
3. When will the bag start to fall?

title: Kaohsiung's Countdown Will Be a Blast!

content.en: In Taiwan, people love staying up late on New Year's Eve and watching fireworks. People countdown to midnight and then... kaboom!
content.tw: 在台灣，我們很喜歡熬夜跨年看煙火秀。

content.en: Most fireworks shows are not long. Kaohsiung City's 2023 fireworks show was three minutes long.
content.tw: 煙火秀通常不會維持很長的時間。高雄2023年煙火秀只有三分鐘長。

content.en: This time, Kaohsiung City is making their fireworks show one minute longer. People will see four minutes of fireworks. Four minutes is short. But in those four minutes, more than 7,000 fireworks will go off!
content.tw: 這一次高雄的煙火秀會多一分鐘，大家可以看到四分鐘的煙火秀，會發射超過7000支煙火。

content.en: The Kaohsiung Eye Ferris Wheel's colorful lights will make the show more beautiful! The fireworks will make the Port of Kaohsiung's waters sparkle!
content.tw: 高雄之眼摩天輪的燈光讓整個表演更漂亮。煙火將照亮整個高雄港。

content.en: Kaohsiung's mayor is excited. His city will shine! Big stars will be at the New Year's Eve countdown party before the fireworks!
content.tw: 高雄市長很期待他的城市發光。眾多明星也會在跨年倒數派對上表演。

content.en: Another fireworks show in Kaohsiung will be 999 seconds long. Kaohsiung's midnight sky will be bright! People are going to have a blast!
content.tw: 高雄另一個煙火秀長達999秒。高雄的跨年夜會很明亮，絕對可以享受跨年。

content.en: The New Year's Eve countdown is in two days. I can't wait to see the firework shows. Happy New Year everybody!
content.tw: 跨年倒數還有兩天。我等不及要看煙火表演了。大家新年快樂！

vocabulary.preface: 高雄的跨年晚會很精彩，會有燦爛的煙火和各種表演。

content.text:
1. party 派對
What's your plan for New Year's Eve? 你跨年夜有什麼計畫?
I'm going to a friend's party. 我要去朋友的派對。

2. minute 分鐘
We can see the Taipei 101 fireworks from her house.
我們可以從她家看台北101煙火。
But that show only lasts three minutes! 但是那場秀只有三分鐘!

3. watch 看
That's good enough for me. 對我來說夠好了。
I've never been so close to it before.我從來沒有那麼靠近過。
I always watch it on YouTube, if at all. 我要是要看，都在YouTube上面看。

4. count down 倒數
It's totally different! 那完全不同!
You get to count down to the New Year with a lot of people!
你跟一大群人一起倒數迎新年!
